For antibiotic-associated pseudomembranous enterocolitis, Vancomycin is the standard treatment due to its effectiveness against Clostridium difficile, the primary cause of this condition. While Amoxicillin is a broad-spectrum antibiotic and part of anti-H. Pylori treatment, it is not indicated for pseudomembranous enterocolitis. Metronidazole is also effective against anaerobic bacteria and is used in anti-H. Pylori regimens, making it a relevant option for both conditions. Clotrimazole, being an antifungal, is not applicable for bacterial infections. Therefore, the best options are Vancomycin for pseudomembranous enterocolitis and Metronidazole for its role in H. Pylori treatment.
